thread.title: LogicFI Named Tech Startup Finalist in Nashville NEXT Awards
thread.title_full: LogicFI Named Tech Startup Finalist in Nashville NEXT Awards

author: Michael Perkins
title: LogicFI Named Tech Startup Finalist in Nashville NEXT Awards
text:
LogicFI, Inc. has been named a finalist in the fifth annual Nashville Chamber of Commerce and Nashville Entrepreneur Center NEXT Awards. Founded in 2014, LogicFI is a lending technology organization specializing in quick, data-driven credit decisions that improve servicing and underwriting for their clients.
The NEXT Awards recognize outstanding businesses and entrepreneurs in five key industries throughout Middle Tennessee. LogicFI is one of four companies nominated in the Tech Startup category.
“We’re honored to be considered for this award,” said Zach Todd, CEO and co-founder of LogicFI. “It’s really a testament to all the hard work our team has put into this product.”
In addition to technology, the NEXT Awards also recognize businesses and entrepreneurs in health care, digital media and entertainment, social enterprise and sustainability, and products and services. They will also name a Young Entrepreneur of the Year and Entrepreneur of the Year.
“This is a really exciting time for us at LogicFI,” Michael Perkins, COO and co-founder, shared. “This nomination is just the icing on the cake.”
Winners will be announced during the NEXT Awards event Thursday, Nov. 19.
-30-
About LogicFI
LogicFI is a financial technology company offering proprietary lending and decisioning platforms that enable financial institutions to enter, complete, and succeed in online lending. LogicFI utilizes data to quickly, efficiently and effectively drive credit decisions in all credit segments. By leveraging underwriting and risk assessment methods evolved from non-traditional data sources, optimizing existing data and decisioning sources and creating dynamic decisioning models, LogicFI is able to offer increased conversion and decreased default while maximizing profitability. Lenders can supplement existing underwriting initiatives while creating an internal credit model for new and existing customers.
